messages.content:
<function_thought>
Since /system/.ssh is a directory, we need to specify the exact file path of the public SSH key. Public SSH keys are typically named id_rsa.pub, id_ecdsa.pub, or id_ed25519.pub. We'll try to read the contents of each of these files in the /system/.ssh directory.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub"), read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_ecdsa.pub"), read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub")]</function_call>

However, to add the SSH key to the GitHub account, we need to use the git_add_ssh_key function. This function requires the SSH key as an argument. We already have the SSH key from the previous step.
</function_thought>
